definition: a staff/a rod/cane/walking stick/to flog with a stick (old)
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
measure of length, ten Chinese feet (3.3 m)/to measure/husband/polite appellation for an older male
the staff of a Buddhist monk
beating with wooden staves (as corporal punishment)

sentences.english: Psionicists are limited to light armor and can use daggers and two -handed staffs.
sentences.chinese: 心灵术士仅能装备轻甲并可使用匕首和双手杖。

sentences.english: They sang upon the sand their song of faith, while with their staff of promise they dug the well.
sentences.chinese: 他们在沙地上唱信心的歌，同时用应许的杖掘井。

sentences.english: A board used for descending snow-covered slopes on one's feet but without ski poles.
sentences.chinese: 滑雪板，用于徒步和没有滑雪杖帮助而从雪坡滑下来。

sentences.english: And the sticks whereon thou writest shall be in thine hand before their eyes.
sentences.chinese: 你所写的那两根杖要在他们眼前拿在手中。

sentences.english: The BS expander makes sure that the telescopic sections hold firm at the adjusted length.
sentences.chinese: BS系统的膨胀拴可以确保调整过长度的杖杆的稳固。

sentences.english: Woe to the Assyrian, the rod of my anger, in whose hand is the club of my wrath!
sentences.chinese: 亚述是我怒气的棍，手中拿我恼恨的杖。

sentences.english: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.
sentences.chinese: 愚蒙迷住孩童的心，用管教的杖可以远远赶除。

sentences.english: They divined metal on the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 他们用占卜杖在山上探测金属。

sentences.english: The staff is for my sheep, but the club is for predators.
sentences.chinese: 杖是牧羊杖，竿是用来对付捕食羊的野兽的。

sentences.english: The staff is for my sheep, but the club is for predators.
sentences.chinese: 杖是牧羊杖，竿是用来对付捕食羊的野兽的。

sentences.english: And I took my staff, even Beauty, and cut it asunder, that I might break my covenant which I had made with all the people.
sentences.chinese: 我折断那称为荣美的杖，表明我废弃与万民所立的约。

sentences.english: Blood Mages are limited to light armor and can use daggers and two-handed staffs.
sentences.chinese: 血法师仅能装备轻甲并可使用匕首和双手杖。

sentences.english: The dirty night is spilled in a gourd ladle, world child bastinado knife enters palace.
sentences.chinese: 在一个瓢泼雨夜，世子杖刀闯入王宫。

sentences.english: Sorcerers are limited to light armor and can use daggers and two-handed staffs.
sentences.chinese: 魔术师仅能装备轻甲并可使用匕首和双手杖。

sentences.english: Folly is bound up in the heart of a boy, nut the rod of discipline drives it far away.
sentences.chinese: 愚蒙迷住孩童的心，用管教的杖可以远远赶除。

sentences.english: I think the real key is using a rise-and-fall action with my rod tip.
sentences.chinese: 我认为最关键的使用的是0杖行动的小费。

definition: whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)
the staff of a Buddhist monk
handle or shaft (of an axe etc)/(of a flower, leaf or fruit) stem/sth that affords an advantage to an opponent/classifier for knives or blades
double-edged sword/CL:口[kou3],把[ba3]/classifier for blows of a sword
halberd/long-handled weapon with pointed tip and crescent blade/combined spear and battle-ax
